history.narrative: Law 2-148, the “District of Columbia Redevelopment Land Agency Tax Exemption Act of 1978,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 2-386, which was referred to the Committee on Housing and Urban Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 28, 1978, and December 12, 1978, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 29, 1978, it was assigned Act No. 2-327 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
